result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Edward Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT:  Pay all of following by end of supervision.  All court costs, fes, surcharges including DNA.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil  judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision by end of supervison.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/count.  Credit for 125 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation unless a doctor indicates he cannot do so.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/count.  Credit for 125 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions as listed on count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Edward Green

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Department of Corrections Attn: Records 2909 E Park Ave. Chippewa Falls, Wi 54729
Effectuating the change from confinement to extended supervision signed and filed.  File forwarded to Clerk's office for processing.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 19 Judge Cimpl. os
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (23 pages) PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING commencing 08-19-2015 received and filed.
Corrected, showing BOTH counts one and two as should be.
Per my clerical error, dispo/sentence now entered into CCAP as to count two.  JOC now showing BOTH counts one and two as should be.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  40 MONTHS with 125 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 20 MONTHS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  40 MONTHS with 125 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 20 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation unless a doctor indicates he cannot do so.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Lawrence Edward Green in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Lawrence Edward Green in custody.  David John Behm for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol (post-rotation judge).  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Lawrence Edward Green not in court, in custody.  Dennis  Murphy for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for the purpose of today's proceedings. Defense has discovery and an offer.  Negotiations are still ongoing. Defense requested a projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Defense requested a substitution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
From the defense with an enclosed request for substitution of judge form received and filed.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Lawrence Edward Green not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has just been appointed, and requests time to talk with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/21/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Edward Green in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Lawrence Edward Green in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests to withdraw.  Court held colloquy with defendant and attorney Phillips.  Court grants request to withdraw.  Atttorney Phillips to inform public defender's office to have new counsel appointed.  Case adjourned for status of counsel on 7/9/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail remains as set.

Attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices in court, defendant Lawrence Edward Green not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 7/1/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Lawrence Edward Green in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Lawrence Edward Green in custody.  Ronald Dague for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #01CF5650 that are attached to the complaint. Sworn for the state:Christopher Navarrette-MPD Officer    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lawrence Edward Green in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Lawrence Edward Green in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
